title: error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic while compiling openssl-sys

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body: ### Code I'm on M1 Mac, and am trying to compile openssl vendored for linux arm and linux aarch using the following: ``` cargo b --release --target aarch64-unknown-linux-gnu cargo b --release --target x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` $ rustc --version --verbose rustc 1.67.1 (d5a82bbd2 2023-02-07) binary: rustc commit-hash: d5a82bbd26e1ad8b7401f6a718a9c57c96905483 commit-date: 2023-02-07 host: aarch64-apple-darwin release: 1.67.1 LLVM version: 15.0.6 ``` ### Error output ``` ``` ``` $ cargo b --release --target aarch64-unknown-linux-gnu Compiling openssl-sys v0.9.80 Compiling openssl v0.10.45 thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value', compiler/rustc_codegen_llvm/src/back/archive.rs:367:33 stack backtrace: 0: 0x102a265c0 - ::fmt::hb33e6e8152f78c95 1: 0x102a77954 - core::fmt::write::hd33da007f7a27e39 2: 0x102a19c78 - std::io::Write::write_fmt::h7edc10723862001e 3: 0x102a263d4 - std::sys_common::backtrace::print::h895ee35b3f17b334 4: 0x102a28e84 - std::panicking::default_hook::{{closure}}::h3b7ee083edc2ea3e 5: 0x102a28bdc - std::panicking::default_hook::h4e7c2c28eba716f5 6: 0x10ac34460 - rustc_driver[a234c6c3a001744e]::DEFAULT_HOOK::{closure#0}::{closure#0} 7: 0x102a2957c - std::panicking::rust_panic_with_hook::h1672176227032c45 8: 0x102a29334 - std::panicking::begin_panic_handler::{{closure}}::h0b2d072f9624d32e 9: 0x102a26a28 - std::sys_common::backtrace::__rust_end_short_backtrace::he9abda779115b93c 10: 0x102a290d0 - _rust_begin_unwind 11: 0x102aa3488 - core::panicking::panic_fmt::h23ae44661fec0889 12: 0x102aa351c - core::panicking::panic::hce667fe29ffebbcd 13: 0x10ade7324 - ::build 14: 0x10dfe3a8c - rustc_codegen_ssa[ea58c8650e29c10d]::back::link::link_binary 15: 0x10ae3694c - ::link 16: 0x10ad143b4 - ::link 17: 0x10ac10a3c - rustc_span[d521b58236fcfe34]::with_source_map::, rustc_interface[5e186cb074b70a2d]::interface::run_compiler, rustc_driver[a234c6c3a001744e]::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#0}::{closure#0}> 18: 0x10ac0475c - >::set::, rustc_driver[a234c6c3a001744e]::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#0}, core[c3092a4e7301e8c6]::result::Result<(), rustc_errors[4dbd0da469f7da4d]::ErrorGuaranteed>> 19: 0x10abd9404 - std[1a4ed070555b2e10]::sys_common::backtrace::__rust_begin_short_backtrace::, rustc_driver[a234c6c3a001744e]::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#0}, core[c3092a4e7301e8c6]::result::Result<(), rustc_errors[4dbd0da469f7da4d]::ErrorGuaranteed>>::{closure#0}::{closure#0}, core[c3092a4e7301e8c6]::result::Result<(), rustc_errors[4dbd0da469f7da4d]::ErrorGuaranteed>> 20: 0x10abbf7b4 - <::spawn_unchecked_, rustc_driver[a234c6c3a001744e]::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#0}, core[c3092a4e7301e8c6]::result::Result<(), rustc_errors[4dbd0da469f7da4d]::ErrorGuaranteed>>::{closure#0}::{closure#0}, core[c3092a4e7301e8c6]::result::Result<(), rustc_errors[4dbd0da469f7da4d]::ErrorGuaranteed>>::{closure#1} as core[c3092a4e7301e8c6]::ops::function::FnOnce<()>>::call_once::{shim:vtable#0} 21: 0x102a31974 - std::sys::unix::thread::Thread::new::thread_start::h92ee0ad602ca1aab 22: 0x1860a206c - __pthread_deallocate error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.67.1 (d5a82bbd2 2023-02-07) running on aarch64-apple-darwin note: compiler flags: --crate-type lib -C opt-level=3 -C linker-plugin-lto -C codegen-units=1 -C linker=aarch64-unknown-linux-gnu-gcc note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: end of query stack error: could not compile `openssl-sys` warning: build failed, waiting for other jobs to finish... ``` ``` $ RUST_BACKTRACE=1 cargo b --release --target aarch64-unknown-linux-gnu Compiling openssl-sys v0.9.80 Compiling openssl v0.10.45 thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value', compiler/rustc_codegen_llvm/src/back/archive.rs:367:33 stack backtrace: 0: _rust_begin_unwind 1: core::panicking::panic_fmt 2: core::panicking::panic 3: ::build 4: rustc_codegen_ssa::back::link::link_binary 5: ::link 6: ::link 7: rustc_span::with_source_map::, rustc_interface::interface::run_compiler, rustc_driver::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#0}::{closure#0}> 8: >::set::, rustc_driver::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#0}, core::result::Result<(), rustc_errors::ErrorGuaranteed>> note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.67.1 (d5a82bbd2 2023-02-07) running on aarch64-apple-darwin note: compiler flags: --crate-type lib -C opt-level=3 -C linker-plugin-lto -C codegen-units=1 -C linker=aarch64-unknown-linux-gnu-gcc note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: end of query stack error: could not compile `openssl-sys` warning: build failed, waiting for other jobs to finish... ```
